mil.nga.giat.geowave.store.query

Interface Query

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DistributableQuery
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BasicQuery, IndexOnlySpatialQuery, SpatialQuery, SpatialTemporalQuery, TemporalQuery

    public interface Query
    This interface fully describes a query

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<QueryFilter> createFilters(CommonIndexModel indexModel)
      This is a list of filters (either client filters or distributed filters) which will be applied to the result set.
      MultiDimensionalNumericData getIndexConstraints(NumericIndexStrategy indexStrategy)
      Return a set of constraints to apply to the primary index based on the indexing strategy used.
      boolean isSupported(Index index)
      This is useful to determine what indices this query supports.

    • Method Detail

      • createFilters

        List<QueryFilter> createFilters(CommonIndexModel indexModel)
        This is a list of filters (either client filters or distributed filters) which will be applied to the result set. QueryFilters of type DistributableQueryFilter will automatically be distributed across nodes, although the class must be on the classpath of each node. Fine-grained filtering and secondary filtering should be applied here as the primary index will only enable coarse-grained filtering.
        Parameters:
        indexModel - This can be used by the filters to determine the common fields in the index
        Returns:
        A list of the query filters

      • isSupported

        boolean isSupported(Index index)
        This is useful to determine what indices this query supports. If an index is not supported the query will not be run on it and no data will be returned from that index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index to check if the query will support.
        Returns:
        A flag indicating if this query supports the index

      • getIndexConstraints

        MultiDimensionalNumericData getIndexConstraints(NumericIndexStrategy indexStrategy)
        Return a set of constraints to apply to the primary index based on the indexing strategy used. The ordering of dimensions within the index stategy must match the order of dimensions in the numeric data returned which will represent the constraints applied to the primary index for the query.
        Parameters:
        indexStrategy - The index strategy used to generate the constraints for
        Returns:
        A multi-dimensional numeric data set that represents the constraints for the index
